issue.title: Add syncplay feature

labels.name: backend
labels.description: Requires work on the server to finish

labels.name: blocked
labels.description: Requires work on the web client to finish

issue.body:
**Changes**
This PR adds playback syncing of different sessions that are watching the same content.
- Users that are playing something can create a group
- Multiple users can join a group to sync the same media
- Playback (play, pause, seek) is synced on all players of a group

The implementation tries to be time and network resistant, meaning that syncing is not based on merely sending the _playback command_ but also tells the clients _when_ to actually run said command. This means shifting the network latency problem to a time synchronization one.

Ideally, the client's time should be correct but, in the event this isn't true, a server time estimation is made by the client (clients always use this at the moment).

A major problem faced was the delay caused by issuing a play command on the web-player and it actually starting the playback. This issue has been solved by speeding up the playback to catch up.
In other words, to implement this feature on other players, the "playback rate" (or speed) should be supported by the player to achieve optimal results.

Feedback and change proposals are welcome.
I'm curious to see whether the current UX is ideal or if some things should be revised.

**Planned features for this PR**
- [x] Option to toggle feature for specific user [User edit > Media Playback > Syncplay access]
- [x] Filter groups by library access and parental rating (needs review)

**Proposed features for future PRs**
- Share the transcoding process with the members of the group
- Manually adjust delay
- Time sync between devices in the same network
- Group types (public, private, personal)
- Group join by PIN

**Features being tackled in next PR**
- Sync playlist as well (more discussion needed)
- Group wait when one or more members of a group are buffering

**Issues**
Addresses some requested features of https://github.com/jellyfin/jellyfin/issues/227.

body:
Take this with a grain of salt - I'm not an authority on any of this...

Did you look into creating this as a plugin?  Guessing some of the UI stuff might make that tough to do?

Also, HasAccessToItem seems like it duplicates some of the code here: https://github.com/jellyfin/jellyfin/blob/master/MediaBrowser.Api/UserLibrary/ItemsService.cs#L182

IMO, Item access code should be centralized and reusable reducing the likelihood of permissions problems.  A method like HasAccesToItem shouldn't be scoped (I don't think?) to Syncplay only...

This is fine to be in core. Not just because it needs to manipulate the frontend and there is no plugin system there, but because this is a feature that falls in the scope of Jellyfin as a media server.

Also, if its in core other clients that may or may not be able to ever have a plugin system can implement this feature like say... Kodi.

> Also, HasAccessToItem seems like it duplicates some of the code here: https://github.com/jellyfin/jellyfin/blob/master/MediaBrowser.Api/UserLibrary/ItemsService.cs#L182
> 
> IMO, Item access code should be centralized and reusable reducing the likelihood of permissions problems. A method like HasAccesToItem shouldn't be scoped (I don't think?) to Syncplay only...

Indeed, I agree that such a method should be placed someplace else, available to other modules as well.
I think that `HasAccesToItem` will eventually end up checking several things, like library access, parental rating, access schedule and related.

issue.title: Remote "watch together" feature?
issue.body:
Would it be difficult to implement an option to sync two viewing sessions on the same Jellyfin server (or optionally across two instances)? I'm not familiar with the code base so I thought I'd throw the question out to those that are.

[SyncLounge](http://synclounge.tv/) seems to be a third party option someone wrote for Plex. I think that if it's not difficult to implement natively, people could consider this feature a huge plus for Jellyfin as well as a possible way to distinguish itself from the commercial options.

body: @OancaAndrei can you clarify what's left to mark this as ready to review?

> @OancaAndrei can you clarify what's left to mark this as ready to review?

@JustAMan Sure, to avoid duplication I moved the progress tracking to the other PR, but I can copy it here as well, if it makes things more clear.

At the moment I'm investigating some issues that appear on Safari browsers.
On a more backend related view, what's currently planned are also public/private groups and PIN protected joining.

> On a more backend related view, what's currently planned are also public/private groups and PIN protected joining.

Those can come as separate PRs enhancing the feature I think. Let's focus on bringing it in the code in the simplest possible form (which allows extending) and improve it later.

> I need to remind that it's not only a burden on you to implement stuff but also a burden on us to review it, so it's waaaaaaaaaaay better to have a thing come in several atomic PRs (each of them should ideally leave the product functional, even if not at the completely desired state) than in one giant PR that would be reviewed for weeks.

I totally agree. I'm pretty happy with the current status of the PR so I think it's ready for review. I didn't mean to overload you with any excessive work.

[This](https://github.com/jellyfin/jellyfin-web/pull/1011#issuecomment-613141147) comment lead me to think that the new features had to be well defined before any merging occurred. And, because the required features by the UI implied changes to this PR as well, I was looking for a structure (group types / participant types) general enough to fit the different usages.

This PR also includes another PR regarding `KeepAlive` of WebSockets. Only now I realize that I should have mentioned it here as well, [link](https://github.com/jellyfin/jellyfin-web/pull/1067#issuecomment-615419028) to other PR.
Something that's missing is how WebSockets are handled server-side when "marked" as lost, although I don't consider it to be a blocking thing for this PR.

> IMHO the first usable stage is when syncplay is possible to be turned on/off globally by server admin and is joinable by anyone on the server.

At the moment, Syncplay can be turned off selectively for single users, while joining a group is restricted to library access and parental rating.

If you think that it's ready for review then I'll mark it as such :grin:.

Also, should the [related](https://github.com/jellyfin/jellyfin-web/pull/1011) PR be marked as _ready for review_ too?
@OancaAndrei I'm officially declaring this as ready! :) @jellyfin/backend let's review and get this awesome feature in :)

> Also, should the [related](https://github.com/jellyfin/jellyfin-web/pull/1011) PR be marked as _ready for review_ too?

That depends on if its state corresponds to the state of this PR, like, if it fits the criteria I have listed [above](https://github.com/jellyfin/jellyfin/pull/2733#issuecomment-616207511).

> That depends on if its state corresponds to the state of this PR, like, if it fits the criteria I have listed [above](https://github.com/jellyfin/jellyfin/pull/2733#issuecomment-616207511).

It does, I tried to keep both PRs synced (haha). My only concern was that point about the UI changing in the future.

Really nice addition!
Lots of small questions, a few related to potential data races inside.

Also I propose to name it "Bonfire Party" (as a party joined around a bonfire to have a celebration), because Syncplay is already a thing. We can even use an icon of a bonfire for syncplay :)

message: Implement syncplay permissions for a user

Check that client is playing the right item

Send date when playback command is emitted
Rename some classes

body:
Nice, we're getting closer! :)

Please don't consider me a nitpicker, it's just the request is big, and we're gradually polishing it to a perfect state.

> Please don't consider me a nitpicker, it's just the request is big, and we're gradually polishing it to a perfect state.

Not at all :smile:, that's exactly what a reviewer should do in order to keep the code base clean.
Not sure if it was mentioned but if we keep SyncPlay as the name it should be capitalized with PascalCase, including on internal classes.

> Not sure if it was mentioned but if we keep SyncPlay as the name it should be capitalized with PascalCase, including on internal classes.

@OancaAndrei this just means replace `Syncplay` with `SyncPlay` almost everywhere :)

> Not sure if it was mentioned but if we keep SyncPlay as the name it should be capitalized with PascalCase, including on internal classes.

The idea was to pick a different name and I was waiting to complete the important stuff first.
I'll make sure to use the PascalCase for the naming.
I don't think we have a better name :laughing: the current name is very accurate and obvious for users so I think it's going to stick around.

> I don't think we have a better name 

Yeah, we tried for a few days to invent a name and have thrown a few ideas off the wall, but it seems `SyncPlay` is the best choice right now :)

I tested this with a total of 4 people watching tonight, and it works pretty well. Only problem I noticed was that if you advance to the next episode early, then that causes whoever pressed the button to leave the group.

So if you want to watch multiple episodes, it seems you may have to remake the group for each episode.

> I tested this with a total of 4 people watching tonight, and it works pretty well.

I'm glad that it worked for you :grin:.

> Only problem I noticed was that if you advance to the next episode early, then that causes whoever pressed the button to leave the group.
>
> So if you want to watch multiple episodes, it seems you may have to remake the group for each episode.

This is indeed the main use case currently, for which films fit better. I know, it's kinda limited.

Playlist sync will surely be added, to ease out the experience, and should fix this issue with TV series as well.

> Playlist sync will surely be added, to ease out the experience

But not in this PR, right?
Mostly LGTM but I want to see my remaining questions addressed first.

> > Playlist sync will surely be added, to ease out the experience
> 
> But not in this PR, right?

I was experimenting with it, but it definitely **won't be** in this PR, sorry if I made you worry.

LGTM, minor only left.

Also please stop rebasing and stuffing all code review fixes in last commit, it forces me to re-read it in full every time instead of seeing what has changed :)

> LGTM, minor only left.
> 
> Also please stop rebasing and stuffing all code review fixes in last commit, it forces me to re-read it in full every time instead of seeing what has changed :)

Snap, I'll keep this in mind for the future. I should've done it at the very end. Sorry for the burden.

Well, actually, from my point of view you _can_ rebase things as long as you don't change commit patches (there's Github feature "marked as viewed" which helps here), but please don't incorporate multiple passes of feedback in single last commit, as instead of checking just response to my last feedback I'm forced to re-read the response to all feedbacks :D
